channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New prosecutor to take on Georgia election case against Trump and others
item.description: A longtime prosecutor announced he will take over the Georgia election interference case against President Trump and others, after Fulton County Distr...

item.title: U.S., Switzerland reach trade deal to bolster manufacturing in America, lower tariffs on Swiss goods
item.description: The U.S. and Switzerland have reached a trade deal that will reduce President Trump's tariffs on the European nation from 39% to 15%, a top administra...

item.title: Hegseth announces operation to remove 'narco-terrorists from our Hemisphere'
item.description: War Secretary Pete Hegseth announced a new U.S. mission, Operation Southern Spear, targeting narco-terror groups across the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: To Win The War For America, The GOP Needs To Realize It’s Happening
item.description: A big number of so-called fellow citizens would cheer if you or I died tomorrow, which leads to only one conclusion: We’re playing for keeps.

item.title: Getting $190 apiece to 42 million Americans has state officials in a post-shutdown SNAP scramble
item.description: About one in eight Americans, in lower-income households, is supposed to get monthly SNAP benefits by law.

item.title: Congress Didn’t Give Trump an Unlimited License to Tariff
item.description: The best legal argument for the Trump tariffs assumes that we are currently in a declared war with every country on the planet.

item.title: The Week: The Shutdown Ends at Last
item.description: Plus: Remembering James Watson and his complicated legacy.

item.title: Hooters CEO says private equity turned it into a ‘boys club hangout’—Now he’s plotting a family-friendly makeover
item.description: “It's a beach-theme restaurant,” Neil Kiefer said.

item.title: Yes, President Trump Can Pardon The 77 People Prosecuted For 2020 Election Integrity Efforts
item.description: Media wrongly insist that the pardon clause only applies to federal charges, yet every attempt to narrow the scope of pardons has failed.

item.title: The GOP Can’t Punt on Health Care
item.description: Failing to introduce and explain Obamacare alternatives represents a serious political risk.

item.title: GOP unity shattered by controversial measure in government shutdown bill
item.description: House and Senate Republicans are at odds over a provision in the federal funding bill that would allow senators to sue over Arctic Frost.

item.title: Prepare For Doctors To Smuggle Suicide And Trans Drugs Into Red States Like Abortion Pills
item.description: State shield laws protecting abortion providers set a dangerous precedent — doctors could mail other dangerous drugs across state lines.

item.title: Congressman says he was 'blown off' by Wisconsin college accused of blocking new TPUSA chapter
item.description: Rep. Derrick Van Orden, R-Wisc., says Beloit College blew off his attempts to discuss the facts surrounding accusations that the Wisconsin school was ...

item.title: Billionaires are swapping art and cars for sports teams as their top ‘trophy’ investment, JPMorgan says
item.description: Three years ago, only 6% of billionaires had controlling stakes in sports teams. Now, that share has jumped to 20%.

item.title: The American Revolution Is About To Experience The ‘Ken Burns Effect’
item.description: As our nation nears its 250th birthday, Ken Burns’ miniseries should give us a newfound appreciation for the sacrifices of our ancestors.

item.title: Trump to ask DOJ to investigate Epstein ties to Democrats, banks

item.description: Football broadcasting legend Paul Finebaum is taking heat for allegedly being a “Trump-hating" weak Republican amid widespread rumors that he is plann...

item.title: DOJ renews claims about Abrego Garcia's gang membership, 'pornographic' messages
item.description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia's membership in MS-13 was a crucial part of his participation in a major migrant smuggling ring, the Trump Justice Department tol...

item.title: ‘Very problematic’ disclosure of ‘confidential competitive’ data between Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac roils housing world
item.description: A confidant of Bill Pulte, Trump's top housing regulator, provided confidential mortgage pricing data, according to emails reviewed by the AP.

item.title: The Spiritual Tariffs on Ballad of a Small Player
item.description: A psychodrama about the West’s diminishing identity.

item.title: Jesse Jackson hospitalized for rare neurological disorder
item.description: The Rev. Jesse Jackson, who has been receiving around-the-clock care at home, has been hospitalized with a rare neurological disorder, according to hi...

item.title: Why Genpact has an Agentic AI Officer and why she dislikes the term ‘human in the loop’
item.description: Jinsook Han says that AI agents, even more so than generative AI, have the power to truly make a difference for the company and its customers.

item.title: You can end a shutdown overnight -- but you can't reopen a government that fast
item.description: The longest government shutdown in U.S. history is over - on paper, at least. But the American public isn't done with it yet: Getting everything back ...

item.title: Don’t Bet the House on the 50-Year Mortgage
item.description: President Trump’s proposed reform would be a terrible deal for homebuyers and taxpayers alike.

item.title: Private Markets: Why Retail Investors Should Stay Away
item.description: Retail access to private markets is growing, but opacity, illiquidity, and weak governance raise serious concerns for investors. The post Private Mark...

item.title: From Sharpe to Pedersen: Why Active Management Isn’t Zero-Sum After All
item.description: Sharpe’s arithmetic explained markets at rest. Pedersen’s model shows markets in motion and how active management creates real economic value. The pos...

item.title: Book Review: On Progress and Prosperity
